results.name: Number of solutions to +-p(1)+-p(2)+-...+-p(2n-1) = 2, where p(i) is the i-th prime.
comment: +-p(1)+-p(2)+-...+-p(2n) = 2 has no solutions, since the left hand side is odd.
link: Alois P. Heinz and Ray Chandler, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000 (first 120 terms from Alois P. Heinz)
maple: A113041:=proc(n) local i,j,p,t; t:= NULL; for j to 2*n-1 by 2 do p:=1; for i to j do p:=p*(x^(-ithprime(i))+x^(ithprime(i))); od; t:=t,coeff(p,x,2); od; t; end;
mathematica: b[n_, i_] := b[n, i] = If[n > sp[i], 0, If[i == 0, 1, b[n + Prime[i], i-1] + b[Abs[n - Prime[i]], i-1]]];
